thread.title: US Issues 'Do Not Travel' Warning for 21 Countries Ahead of Summer
thread.title_full: US Issues 'Do Not Travel' Warning for 21 Countries Ahead of Summer

author: Shukriya Shahi
title: US Issues 'Do Not Travel' Warning for 21 Countries Ahead of Summer
text:
As summer vacation begins, the US State Department has raised red flags for travelers. A total of 21 countries have been slapped with the most severe Level 4 advisory â€” â€˜Do Not Travelâ€™ â€” citing reasons like war, terrorism, crime, and unstable governments.
The travel advisory system has four levels:
Level 1: Exercise Normal Precautions
Ideal for safe travel. Countries include:

Level 2: Exercise Increased Caution
Travel is still allowed but requires awareness of risks such as crime or unrest.

High-Risk Mexican States & Gaza
The advisory also extends to six Mexican states:
Colima, Guerrero, Michoacan, Sinaloa, Tamaulipas, and Zacatecas â€“ flagged due to organized crime and kidnapping.
Gaza is also under a Level 4 alert due to ongoing conflict.
Travel Smart: Tips for Americans Abroad
The State Department urges all travelers to:
- Enroll in the Smart Traveler Enrollment Program (STEP)
- Follow @TravelGov on social media
- Review country-specific security reports
- Have an emergency contingency plan
- Check off the Travelerâ€™s Checklist before departure
Bottom Line: If youâ€™re planning a summer getaway, double-check your destinationâ€™s advisory level. Safety comes firstâ€”some dream vacations might be better saved for another time.
